brief.brief: The validity table enables you to specify a list of valid values for fields in the database.

Service Manager uses the Validity table for validating operator-entered data and for look-up processing. Having the valid values and definitions consolidated results in easy maintenance. This can be of significant benefit when multiple forms access one table.

detail.detail: The valid values of a field can be literals (10, 20, 30, or 40), ranges (50 thru 60), or a combination of both.
You can choose whether to validate fields in a particular order (fieldx, fielda, fieldg) or in alphabetical order (fielda, fieldg, fieldx).
If the current value of a field is invalid, Service Manager displays a Summary list of the Values or Ranges.
You can correct the invalid value and continue processing; return to the calling application; or force the application to accept the invalid value.
After determining that a field contains a valid Value or Range, Service Manager runs any user-defined processing statements.
Validity Processing continues to the next field in the Validity Definition table until all it validates all specified fields.
